intro: Sisymbrium roxolanicum, commonly known as the scarlet mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands and along roadsides. Sisymbrium roxolanicum is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
